claimReward(uint256).custom:throws: PeriodNotEnded if the specified period has not yet endedNotSetReward if no reward has been set for the specified periodAlreadyClaimed if the caller has already claimed their reward for this period
claimReward(uint256).details: The reward amount is calculated based on the user's contribution relative to the total contributions for the specified period and tag. The formula is: (totalReward * userContribution) / totalContributions

params.periodNumber: The period number for which the reward is being claimed

getClaimableReward(uint256,address).details: The reward amount is calculated based on the user's contribution relative to the total contributions for the specified period and tag. Returns 0 if the period has not ended, no reward has been set, or the user has already claimed their reward.

params.periodNumber: The period number for which to calculate the claimable reward
params.user: The address of the user for whom to calculate the claimable reward

returns._0: The amount of tokens the user can claim as reward for the specified period

initialize(address,address).custom:throws: AddressZero if either address parameter is the zero address
initialize(address,address).details: This function can only be called once due to the initializer modifier

params._contribution: Address of the Contribution contract for accessing contribution scores
params._intmaxToken: Address of the INTMAX token used for reward distribution

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setReward(uint256,uint256).custom:throws: RewardTooLarge if amount exceeds uint248 max valueAlreadySetReward if reward for this period has already been set
setReward(uint256,uint256).details: Only callable by the contract owner

params.amount: The total amount of tokens to distribute as rewards for the given period
params.periodNumber: The period number for which the reward is being set

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

claimReward(uint256).notice: Claims the caller's share of rewards for a specific period

claimed(uint256,address).notice: Mapping to track which users have claimed rewards for which periods

constructor.notice: Constructor that disables initializers to prevent implementation contract initialization

contribution().notice: Reference to the Contribution contract for accessing contribution scores

getClaimableReward(uint256,address).notice: Calculates the claimable reward amount for a specific user and period

initialize(address,address).notice: Initializes the contract with required dependencies

intmaxToken().notice: Reference to the INTMAX token contract for reward distribution

setReward(uint256,uint256).notice: Sets the total reward amount for a specific period

totalRewards(uint256).notice: Mapping of period numbers to their total reward information
